title: Services & Pricing: full 30-item catalog, gradient theme, and 3D category icons

requirements.summary: Expand Services & Pricing page to render the complete 30-item pricing catalog grouped into English sections with exact INR prices and provided bullet features.
acceptanceCriteria: The Services & Pricing page shows all 30 offerings, each with its name, INR price formatted with the ₹ symbol, and the exact bullet list items provided by the user.

Offerings are grouped under clear English section headers that correspond to the user’s groupings (e.g., “Website Packages”, “WhatsApp Automation”, “Lead Generation Systems”, “Personal Brand Services”, “SEO Services”, “AI & Automation”, “Business Systems”, “Outreach Systems”, “E-commerce”, “Student Special Packages”, “Complete Low-Ticket Growth Engine”).
No offerings from the user list are missing or merged; each appears as its own card/listing.

file_operations.description: Replace the current small tier list with a static, in-code catalog that includes ALL 30 offerings from msg-8, grouped into the requested English section headings. Ensure each offering card renders: offering name, exact INR price with ₹, and the exact bullet features text provided by the user (no merging or paraphrasing). Keep the existing CheckoutDialog wiring pattern (selected item -> dialog props).

requirements.summary: Apply premium gradient-themed styling (background accents, card highlights, spacing, typography hierarchy) to the Services & Pricing page with responsive layout and English-only UI text.
acceptanceCriteria: The pricing page uses visible gradient styling (e.g., subtle gradient background and/or gradient borders/highlights on cards) consistently across sections and cards.
The page remains mobile-first and responsive (single-column on small screens, multi-column grids on larger screens).
All headings, buttons, and helper text displayed to users are English.

file_operations.description: Update layout to be mobile-first with responsive grids per section, and apply consistent gradient-themed styling (e.g., subtle gradient page background, gradient borders/accents on cards, premium spacing and typography hierarchy). Ensure all user-facing headings/helper text remain English.

Add or refine app-wide utility classes (within existing @layer utilities) that support the pricing page’s premium gradient look (e.g., reusable gradient border/accent helpers) without modifying any shadcn/ui source files.

requirements.summary: Render gradient-styled 3D icons for categories/offerings on the pricing page using ServiceNiche3dIcon and existing base-path-safe asset URL mapping with fallback behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Each pricing section (or each offering card) displays a 3D icon near the title area.
Icons load via static frontend assets (no backend image serving) and are base-path safe.
If an icon fails to load, the existing SafeImage fallback renders a non-technical fallback (e.g., initials) and the page remains usable.

requirements.summary: Replace the single Monthly Maintenance card with a Monthly Maintenance Plans section containing exactly three plans and the provided included bullets.
acceptanceCriteria: The pricing page shows a “Monthly Maintenance Plans” section containing exactly three plan cards/entries: Student, Business, Pro, with the exact monthly prices provided.
Each maintenance plan displays the included bullets: “Minor updates”, “Basic support”, “Monitoring”.
The previous single maintenanceTier presentation is no longer shown on the page.

file_operations.description: Remove the existing single maintenanceTier UI and replace it with a “Monthly Maintenance Plans” section containing exactly three plans: Student ₹499/month, Business ₹999/month, Pro ₹1,999/month. Each plan must display the included bullets exactly: Minor updates, Basic support, Monitoring. Include a section-level (or plan-level) 3D icon keyed to the new maintenance plans mapping.

requirements.summary: Ensure every offering and maintenance plan has two English CTAs (Select Plan, Get Started) and that at least one CTA per card opens the existing CheckoutDialog with correct service name and amount.
acceptanceCriteria: Every offering card includes two visible buttons labeled “Select Plan” and “Get Started”.
Clicking at least one of the CTAs per offering opens the existing CheckoutDialog with the correct service name and amount for that offering.
Buttons are English-labeled and remain readable/accessible on mobile.

file_operations.description: Update offering cards and maintenance plan cards to display two visible English-labeled buttons: “Select Plan” and “Get Started”. Wire at least one button per card to the existing handleCheckout logic so CheckoutDialog opens with the correct serviceName and amount for that offering/plan. Keep button layout responsive and accessible on mobile.
